title: Pôle Méca seminar series
text:
Register as a speaker
Please indicate in the sheet below your:

Name
Lab
Presentation title
Format

Short (around 20 minutes)
Long (around 40-45 minutes)

Any other remarks (schedule constraints, other format, etc.)

The sheet can also be directly accessed from: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1U3RrbkfuEJfEymMEQy5uzr9ZSJeeTyjdcvFXVCh01B8/edit?gid=2037295576#gid=2037295576.

title: Additional resources
text:
The package microtype helps improving the rendering of long text easily
Quarto is an open-source librairy that enables to create dynamic scientific documents, presentations, and websites using Markdown, LaTeX, and a variety of programming languages (including python, R, etc.).

The html presentations can then be translated into pdfs using decktape.

install node brew install node
install decktape npm install -g decktape
reveal --size=1600x1000 presentation.html presentation.pdf

title: Additional resources
text:
Figures editing

Miscellaneous

Scientific drawing with inkscape monthly letter here.
Good practices regarding figure formating

Colour science (Crameri, Shephard, and Heron 2020) and colour map choices
10 rules for better figures in scientific writting (Rougier, Droettboom, and Bourne 2014)
Nice tool for plotting data in latex: PGFplot

title: Pôle Méca seminar series
text:
This wiki serves as a central hub for the Pôle Méca internal seminar series. This series consists of weekly seminars co-organized by all labs from the Pôle Mécanique. Anyone (PhD students, postdocs, and permanent faculty members) are welcome to present their work!



Schedule: View the upcoming seminar schedule.
Past Seminars Archive: Access previous seminar presentations and slide decks.
Registration page: Register to present your work at an upcoming seminar.
Miscellaneous: Additional information and tools to support your daily scientific activities.





Arianna Giannetti (LadHyX) : arianna.giannetti@polytechnique.edu.
Thomas Lavigne (LMS) : thomas.lavigne@polytechnique.edu.
André Stabile (IMSIA) : andre.de-figueiredo-stabile@ensta.fr.
Flavien Loiseau (IMSIA) : flavien.loiseau@ensta.fr.

title: Pôle Méca seminar series
text:
Pôle Méca internal seminars schedule


The internal seminars usually take place at :

Time: Friday, 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 a.m.
Venue: Amphi 104 (Pôle Mécanique)

You can subscribe to the internal seminars schedule using the ICS link in your favorite calendar app:

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/polemecanique/internal_seminars/refs/heads/main/Resources/internal_seminars_pole_mecanique.ics
